title: Temporary Work (Long Stay Activity) visa (subclass 401)
summary: This page provides information for existing holders and approved sponsors of the Temporary Work (Long Stay Activity) visa (subclass 401), which closed to new applications on 19 November 2016. It explains visa rights, obligations for visa holders and sponsors, and the transition to the Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408). The content includes details on visa duration, permitted activities, family rules, required notifications, and sponsorship obligations.

applicable_audience: Current holders of a subclass 401 visa
Approved sponsors of subclass 401 visa holders

visa_validity.general_duration: Duration of the nominated position, or up to two years (whichever is earlier)
visa_validity.sport_stream_condition: Stay usually permitted only for the duration of the sporting season

what_the_visa_allows: Stay in Australia for the period of the nominated position (maximum two years)
Perform the work or activity specified in the nomination
Enter and leave Australia multiple times while the visa is valid

general_obligations: Comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws
Continue to meet requirements of the visa stream
Leave Australia when the visa ends unless granted another visa
Only work or engage in activities for the employer identified in the nomination
Only engage in work or activities consistent with the nominated position
if_employment_ceases: Find another employer willing to sponsor/support and apply for a new visa (subclass 401 closed; may consider subclass 408)
Leave Australia within 28 days or sooner if the visa ends earlier

family_member_rules.entry_conditions: Family cannot enter Australia before the main visa holder
family_requirements: Remain members of the family unit
family_entitlements: Can work or study while their visa is valid

must_notify_changes: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport

sponsorship_status.note: Cannot apply to sponsor new subclass 401 applicants
sponsorship_status.transition_requirement: From 19 May 2017, apply online for approval as a temporary activities sponsor for subclass 408 applicants

sponsor_information.vevo_access: Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO for Organisations)

general_obligations: Notify the department when certain events occur
Provide records and information to the Minister when requested
Not recover, transfer, or charge certain costs to another person
Pay costs to locate and remove an unlawful non-citizen
Ensure the visa holder participates in the nominated occupation, program, or activity
stream_specific_obligations: Secure an offer of reasonable standard accommodation
Pay travel costs for sponsored people to leave Australia
Make the same position available to Australian exchange participants

requirements: All records must be reproducible and verifiable
Keep records of all notifications made to the department including date, method, and location
exchange_sport_domestic_worker_streams.obligation_end: Two years after no longer an approved sponsor and no longer sponsoring anyone

requirements: Keep all compliance records in reproducible and verifiable format
Keep written requests for outward travel costs for sponsored visa holders or family
Keep records of how travel costs were paid, amounts, recipients, and dates

providing_records_and_information.obligation: Must provide requested records/information to departmental officers
conditions: Requests must relate to sponsorship obligations or administrative actions
Must provide any record required under Australian law or as part of sponsorship obligations
providing_records_and_information.obligation_end: Two years after sponsorship ceases and no sponsored visa holders remain
